column4: well... I'm still stuck with  640x480, 800x600 and 1024x768...  what can I do?  please <:)

Weird!!  I try to play an mp3 with AmaroK or Music Player and it ways it's not a sound stream (or playlist finished) .. but now this is a file I'm listening to many time a day...  I know it is a working mp3
have you installed mp3 codecs?
no
didn't know I needed them...
you need to install them ;)  ubout sent you a link
thanks, everything works now... I just had to look in the add/remove application and search for mp3 codec
you need build-essential
thanks again
, cant find it in the add/remove, should I install adept .. or is it somewhere else.. or under another name?
build-essential, it'll be in apt-get, or whatever GUI you use, or 'sudo apt-get install build essential' will do it
what can I answer to this :   What is the location of the directory of C header files that match your running kernel?
you need to install the linux-headers first
apt-get install linux-headers ???
sorry, that link doesn't have it.  um, linux-headers-arch where arch is your kernels arch
well.. okay it just listed me tons of linux-headers packages... I guess in my case linux-headers-2.6.15-27-386 2.6.15-27.48 should do it
dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
already got caught with that... won't do it again, it f/%/cks everything up.. from the keyboard to the resolution and going by the refresh rate...
no, that's the way to do it.
you looking to do it with apache2? or just on it's own?
on it's own... first I'd like to know how to get it
read that page, but ignore the stuff that isn't just the base mysql packages ;)
